title: 104_s1725
content: The "National Discovery Trails Act of 1996" amends the National Trails System Act to include discovery trails along with recreation, scenic, and historic trails. The National Trails System Act is amended to include National Discovery Trails, which are extended, continuous, interstate trails connecting various regions of the United States and representing diverse trail and community examples for conservation and enjoyment of natural, cultural, and historic resources. The National Trails System Act is amended to include National Discovery Trails, which are extended, continuous, interstate trails connecting various regions of the United States and representing diverse trail and community examples for conservation and enjoyment of significant natural, cultural, and historic resources. The National Trails System Act is amended to include National Discovery Trails, which are extended, continuous, interstate trails connecting various regions of the United States and representing diverse trail and community examples for conservation and enjoyment of significant natural, cultural, and historic resources. Additionally, the American Discovery Trail is designated as a National Discovery Trail. The American Discovery Trail, a 6,000-mile trail from Delaware to California, is designated as a National Discovery Trail under the amended National Trails System Act. It splits into Northern and Southern Midwest routes before rejoining in Denver and continuing through several states. The trail is described in a 1995 National Park Service feasibility study. The National Park Service Director administers the trail in cooperation with other agencies. The trail is not subject to certain sections of the National Trails System Act. Amendments are made for the Continental Divide National Scenic Trail, North Country National Scenic Trail, and national discovery trails. A plan for the American Discovery Trail is included in the Act. The responsible nonprofit organization for the American Discovery Trail must submit a comprehensive plan for the protection, management, development, and use of the trail to the relevant committees after consulting with various stakeholders. This plan should include specific objectives and practices for the administration and management of the trail, including the preservation of significant natural, historical, and cultural resources. The comprehensive plan for the American Discovery Trail includes preserving natural, historical, and cultural resources, model agreements for joint trail administration, a 10-year corridor protection plan, development plans with costs, and a process for implementing trail markers. SEC. 5. ADMINISTRATION. The Secretary will administer national discovery trails in cooperation with nonprofit organizations. SEC. 6. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Section 5 of the National Trails System Act is amended to include national historic and national discovery trails. The Act is further amended to include national discovery trails in addition to scenic and national historic trails. The National Trails System Act is amended to include national historic and national discovery trails, adding national discovery trails to scenic and national historic trails.
